comments.body: +1 to these variables, makes it a lot easier to read, thanks.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +833,837 @@        doc_info = self._get_docs()
        doc = None
        documentation_exists = False
        examples_exist = False
        returns_exist = False

@@ -1,1 +900,904 @@                    self.reporter.error(
                        path=self.object_path,
                        code=333,
                        msg='ANSIBLE_METADATA.status  must be exactly one of "deprecated" or "removed"'
                    )

comments.body: This will traceback on Python 2.x since `str.isidentifier` was added in Python 3.x. Do we want to make `validate-modules` Python 3.x only going forward?

I was under the impression we were only supporting it on py3 already.  I've closed a few issues about py2 compatibility.

So yes, I'd prefer just targeting py3.

In that can you update the sanity test to reflect that?

https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/d901ba18d11063bd95843c0fbf8e6ec85b609663/test/runner/lib/sanity/validate_modules.py#L42

Here's how it's done for the `pylint` test:

https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/d901ba18d11063bd95843c0fbf8e6ec85b609663/test/runner/lib/sanity/pylint.py#L65-L67
Note: It's preferable to use Mapping rather than dict.  That way a Mapping object that does not inherit from dict would be recognized.
That's really good to know. Thank you.
